channel.title: Case Study on COMP6441 Musings
channel.description: Recent content in Case Study on COMP6441 Musings

item.title: Security Everywhere: Tracking Apps
item.description: Where do you draw the line between tracking apps, and stalking apps?

item.title: Lab 7
item.description: Was unavailable to make this week’s tutorial (as well) so thankfully my tutor had collated everything we discussed!

item.title: Lab 6
item.description: I stayed at home instead of going to my tutorial because I was abit stressed out and underprepared for the two exams I had the day after :( - Luckily I steal everyone’s notes and synthesise it!

item.title: Security Everwhere: WhatsApp & Telegram Media File Jacking
item.description: Recently the security peeps at Symantec released a proof of concept attack of “Media File Jacking” on the Android platform - namely through WhatsApp and Telegram.

item.title: Lab 5
item.description: Collision occurences > Birthday occurences => B R O K E N

item.title: Security Everywhere: Google Calendar Outage
item.description: It was 1:54am, and I was about to prepare to go to sleep.

item.title: Lab 03 - Looking at Doors of Planes
Case Study: Plane Doors
item.description: “an approved flight crew compartment door that is designed to resist penetration by small arms fire and grenade shrapnel, and to resist forcible intrusions by unauthorised persons.

item.title: Security Everywhere: JB Hi-Fi & Bing Lee Raids
item.description: Over a weekend, several JB Hi-Fi and Bing Lee stores were raided, having lots and lots of electronics and appliances stolen.

item.title: Security Everywhere: ANU Data Breach
item.description: If I had a dollar for every time the ANU data breach was said to be “sophisticated”… On the 17th May 2019, an alleged 19 years worth of records and data was reported to have been accessed and stolen.

item.title: Lab 01 - Looking at the Deepwater Horizon Accident
Case Study: The Deepwater Horizon Accident
